title: A.Clockwork.Orange.1971.720p.BluRay.DTS.x264.AVI.[PublicHD]
description:
This video is the result of brutal struggle between me and an MKV file *of spectacularly high quality* (see torrent #8366709 by user "aoloffline") containing the well known (and brilliant) film adaptation of Anthony Burgess' equally brilliant and well known 1962 novella entitled "A Clockwork Orange" (ie. the one directed by Stanley Kubrick) transformed into something of commensurate quality, however with the added bonus that my machine can actually render it. 

The resulting AVI contained here is identical in terms of video quality, but of "slightly lesser" quality in terms of audio (1500 kbps vs. 192 kbps or ~ 88% reduced).

However, also included in this torrent is a dummy video containing the original DTS audio stream. That audio stream is of the same quality you'd expect (and would be required) for your local movie theatre.

I have $10.00 speakers. I couldn't possibly tell the difference. So I don't need it.

So now at least I (and you too) can watch this movie with *perfect visual quality* and decent audio quality (192 kbps, 48KHz cbr mp3).

But, like I said, if you happen to have a MEGA SOUND SYSTEM and a BLISTERINGLY FAST computer then you can simply merge the "DTS" audio back into the AVI and play the movie on as large a television screen as you can buy and with the best stereo system you can afford. Or, if you like, on a movie theatre's screen and with a movie theatre's sound system.
